business.headline: Shriram Finance share price jumps 4% today. Here's why it's gainingThe stock moved higher after global brokerage MUFG raised its target price on Shriram Finance, citing the strong strategic impact of its recent deal and the potential for a re-rating.

Infosys shares rise 3% today. Why is the IT giant's stock price rising?Shares in the Bengaluru-based software services firm were up 2.18% on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) at 10:10 am to trade at Rs 1,674.50, reflecting stronger sentiment after the company addressed market speculation linked to sharp ADR moves last week.

Foxconn's new women-led iPhone plant in India hires 30,000 staff: ReportThe workers receive free accommodation, subsidised meals, and earn an average salary of around Rs 18,000 per month, among the highest for women in blue-collar manufacturing roles.
Sensex jumps over 500 points: Why is stock market rising today?The Sensex was trading at 85,434.75, up 505.39 points at 9:31 am, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 166.50 points to 26,132.90.
Sensex opens 372 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Infosys jumps 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 491.74 points to 85,421.10, while the NSE Nifty50 added 157.75 points to 26,124.15 as of 9:29 am.

Gold surges to record high: Why is it rising again?Gold, which is seen as a safe store of value during uncertain times, has risen 67% so far this year. While gold touched new highs, silver prices moved in the opposite direction in the domestic market.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market continue to fall or open higher?Gift Nifty futures were trading at around 26,190 points at 7:52 am IST, pointing to a positive start for the Nifty, compared with Friday's close of 25,966.4. This suggests markets may try to recover after a weak spell.

India in goldilocks phase with 8% growth, low inflation: RBI GovernorIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Sanjay Malhotra described the Indian economy as being in a 'Goldilocks period' characterised by high GDP growth of 8 per cent and low inflation.

India is flying more, but why do airlines still struggleIndia's skies are busier than ever, airports are expanding, and passengers are flying in record numbers. Yet the business of running an airline remains unforgiving.

New insurance rules: Will claim settlements improve for policyholders?The new insurance laws strengthen oversight and enforcement. In this special report, IndiaToday.in examines whether that will actually improve claim settlements for policyholders.
Silver slips after hitting record high of Rs 2.04 lakh/kg in Delhi, gold flatSpot silver was trading 0.56 per cent higher at USD 65.85 per ounce in the overseas trade.

From ports to airports: What pushed Adani Group into aviationJeet Adani, Gautam Adani's younger son and a director at Adani Airports, said the experience gained in ports and logistics helped the group enter aviation with confidence.

Why Jeet Adani says resilience is the next big challenge for Indian aviationWhile speaking to India Today, Adani said that aviation is a fragile system in which even small issues can quickly escalate into major problems.

Navi Mumbai airport will be one of most sustainable airports in world: Jeet AdaniSpeaking in the 'Jab We Met' segment, Jeet Adani said development and ecology should not be viewed as opposing ideas. He said large infrastructure projects must grow in a way that protects natural systems, as this also helps safeguard long-term assets and operations.
Built for the future: Jeet Adani on how Navi Mumbai Airport changes Mumbai aviationJeet Adani said the new airport will unlock long-term growth and improve global connectivity for the city.

Avadhut Sathe gets interim relief as SAT defreezes accounts for expensesIn August, Sebi conducted a search-and-seizure operation at Avadhut Sathe's Karjat Trading Academy as part of a broader crackdown on financial influencers offering market advice without proper registration.
Sensex ends 447 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; RIL up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 447.55 points to close at 84,929.36, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 150.85 points to end at 25,966.40.

Got an SMS or email from the Income Tax Department? Here's what it meansGot an unexpected SMS or email from the Income Tax Department about your transactions and unsure what to do next? The department has clarified the purpose behind these alerts.

Adani Group to bid for 11 airports amid India's air travel boom: ReportThe Indian government has been leasing out government-owned airports on long-term contracts to private companies. At the same time, it is encouraging the construction of new airports to improve connectivity across the country.

8th Pay Commission update: How big could be the salary hike and what to expectHere's what central government employees can realistically expect from the 8th Pay Commission now that the 7th CPC's term ends in December 2025 and when the cash might actually hit bank accounts.

entertainment.headline: Double Eviction Shakes Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Aadhirai, FJ Out The weekend episodes of Bigg Boss Tamil Season 9 featured double eliminations and emotional moments, with Aadhirai and FJ leaving the house and the prized family visit privilege shifting to VJ Parvathy.

The Great Flood review: When spectacle drowns substanceRelease Date:Fri Dec 19, 2025 The Great Flood presents a gripping survival story set against record floods in Seoul. However, its shift into unclear sci-fi elements weakens the emotional impact and narrative focus.

Amid Dhurandhar box office run, Ranveer-Deepika fly out for New Year. See pics Actor Ranveer Singh was seen at Mumbai airport with his actor-wife Deepika Padukone and family on Monday morning. The duo reportedly left for a New Year's holiday as 'Dhurandhar' storms the box office.

Don't harass us: Kumar Sanu's ex-wife Rita Bhattacharya on Rs 50-crore lawsuit Singer Kumar Sanu has initiated legal proceedings against his ex-wife, Rita Bhattacharya, citing defamation after she made allegations in recent interviews and social media posts.

Olivia Rodrigo and Louis Partridge split after two years of dating: Report Pop star Olivia Rodrigo and British actor Louis Partridge have reportedly ended their relationship after dating for almost two years. Rodrigo was also seen emotional at a recent holiday party hosted by Lily Allen in London, as per reports.

Malhaar Rathod says food, humour helped bond with Elvish Yadav on Aukaat Ke Bahar Malhaar Rathod revealed how humour and food helped her build an on-screen chemistry with Elvish Yadav in Aukaat Ke Bahar. The actor also revealed she wasn't sure for the longest time if she would be able to act.

Priyanka, Nick and Jonas brothers jive to Qurbani's Aap Jaisa Koi. Watch video Nick Jonas and his brothers discovered a new pre-show hype song, and it is a Bollywood classic. This time, Priyanka Chopra, too, joined the Jonas Brothers, as they grooved to the song.

Did Bridgerton's showrunner hint at a major Benophie book moment? Speculation around Bridgerton's fourth season intensifies as showrunner Jess Brownell's recent remarks suggest a key scene involving Benedict and Sophie may be included, drawing significant attention from readers of Julia Quinn's novels.

Vicky Kaushal rejects 'patriotism as formula' debate amid Dhurandhar's success Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' and Vicky Kaushal's 'Chhaava' have both crossed Rs 800 crore globally, fuelling discussions about patriotism as a box office strategy. Vicky, however, asserts that their success cannot be attributed to any formula.

Ramya Krishnan watches Padayappa in theatre for the 1st time, shares joyful moments Actor Ramya Krishnan watched her iconic film Padayappa in a theatre for the first time. In a promotional interview, Rajinikanth hinted at a sequel focusing on her character Neelambari, sparking excitement among fans.

Is Telugu cinema falling behind in the pan-India race? Why 2025 felt like a warning Despite big openings and Rs 100 crore films, Telugu cinema's pan-India presence weakened in 2025, raising questions about over-dependence on stars, shrinking creative risk, and the sustainability of the current model.

Who is Kalyan Padala, first commoner to win Bigg Boss Telugu 9? Kalyan Padala, a former Indian army soldier, made history by becoming the first commoner to win Bigg Boss Telugu Season 9. The grand finale saw him take home the winner's trophy, Rs 35 lakh, and a new car.

Dhurandhar box office day 17: Ranveer beats Ranbir's Animal, enters all-time top 10 'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has entered the all-time top 10 Indian films and crossed the box office collection of Ranbir Kapoor's film 'Animal'. Its robust box office performance is despite facing competition from major releases such as 'Avatar: Fire & Ash'.

Why Pandora must lead Avatar's story again, not human drama Avatar was never just about humans on an alien planet — it was about discovering a world unlike our         own. By the third film, however, human family drama dominates the narrative, pushing Pandora's unique cultures and ideas to the margins.

Bowen Yang bids farewell to Saturday Night Live in Ariana Grande special Bowen Yang shared the stage with Ariana Grande during the Christmas episode of Saturday Night Live. This marked his final appearance as a cast member. The episode featured heartfelt moments and tributes as Yang reflected on his tenure with the show.

James Ransone of The Wire and It: Chapter Two dies at 46, tributes pour in Actor James Ransone, recognised for performances in projects such as 'The Wire' and 'It: Chapter Two', has died at the age of 46. His death was confirmed by the Los Angeles County Medical Examiner.

Kate Winslet opens up on the challenges of directing her first film Goodbye June Kate Winslet opened up about the challenges of juggling acting, producing and directing her debut film Goodbye June, admitting she initially tried to recast herself as the workload felt overwhelming.

Bigg Boss Telugu Season 9: Commoner Kalyan Padala beats Thanuja to lift trophy  After weeks of drama, emotions and intense competition, Bigg Boss Telugu Season 9 came to a grand close with Kalyan emerging as the winner.

Shraddha Kapoor's sweet reply to coffee date joke with Big B on KBC 17 wins hearts Shraddha Kapoor had a witty and adorable response after a contestant on Kaun Banega Crorepati 17 jokingly asked Amitabh Bachchan to help him take her out for coffee.

general news.headline: Air India Delhi-Mumbai flight turns back after engine oil pressure drops to zeroAn Air India flight from Delhi to Mumbai returned shortly after take-off due to a critical engine oil pressure drop, ensuring passenger safety through prompt action.

India is a Hindu nation, no constitutional approval needed: Mohan BhagwatRSS chief Mohan Bhagwat emphasised that India would remain a Hindu nation as long as people celebrate the cultural heritage of the country and the glory of their ancestors.

Sorry Mummy, Papa: Engineering student dies by suicide, cites exam stress in notePolice said a suicide note recovered from the room states that the student felt she could not meet her parents' expectations and was distressed about her academic performance and financial burden on the family.

Dhurandhar box office day 17: Ranveer beats Ranbir's Animal, enters all-time top 10'Dhurandhar', starring Ranveer Singh, has entered the all-time top 10 Indian films and crossed the box office collection of Ranbir Kapoor's film 'Animal'. Its robust box office performance is despite facing competition from major releases such as 'Avatar: Fire & Ash'.

Hidden world of Cholanaikkans, isolated Kerala tribe that lives by sunlightEntry into their habitat is restricted, and interactions with the outside world are carefully mediated by government authorities to protect a fragile culture that could be irreversibly altered by sustained contact.

50 Indians still trapped in Russian army, 26 dead amid unending Ukraine warOver 200 Indians have been drafted into the Russian armed forces since the start of the war in Ukraine, the government told the Parliament. The Centre said while it was successful in getting some back, 50 Indians still remained trapped. This even as 26 were killed and seven missing amid the war that seems to have no end.

US Justice Department restores Trump photo in Epstein files after backlashThe Justice Department briefly removed and then restored a photograph featuring President Donald Trump from the Jeffrey Epstein investigative files, sparking political debate in the US. The removal was due to concerns about victim privacy, not the president himself, according to officials.

A snub that stings: What Shubman Gill can learn from Rohit SharmaSeen as India's future across formats as recently as a few months ago, Shubman Gill now faces a rare pause. His T20 World Cup omission hurts, but history suggests setbacks shape leaders more than seamless ascents ever do.

Priyanka, Nick and Jonas brothers jive to Qurbani's Aap Jaisa Koi. Watch videoNick Jonas and his brothers discovered a new pre-show hype song, and it is a Bollywood classic. This time, Priyanka Chopra, too, joined the Jonas Brothers, as they grooved to the song.

The day I blast…: Surya's speech on poor form at Ahmedabad university goes viralBacked despite lean returns, Suryakumar Yadav reiterated his acknowledgement of a dip in T20I form in 2025. The India captain will be under pressure as he prepares the team for the T20 World Cup, starting February 7.

Gold surges to record high: Why is it rising again?Gold, which is seen as a safe store of value during uncertain times, has risen 67% so far this year. While gold touched new highs, silver prices moved in the opposite direction in the domestic market.

J&K boy, 6, finds object in dump, turns out to be China-made weapon telescopeA six-year-old boy in Jammu and Kashmir found a suspicious Chinese-made telescope near a garbage dump, leading to a security alert and police action. Authorities have intensified checks near sensitive areas to ensure safety and investigate the incident.

Samantha Ruth gets mobbed in Hyderabad days after Nidhhi Agerwal incident. VideoSamantha Ruth Prabhu was mobbed by a large crowd during a work-related outing in Hyderabad, days after a similar incident involving Nidhhi Agerwal, with videos of the chaos going viral online.

This tech company is gifting up to Rs 1.5 crore flats to employees, here is whyA Chinese automotive tech firm is turning heads by rewarding long-serving employees with premium flats worth up to Rs 1.5 crore to secure loyalty and retain skilled talent.

Violence norm in Bangladesh, Yunus powerless: Sheikh Hasina as extremism spiralsIn her interview, Sheikh Hasina said that Bangladesh is sliding into chaos under the interim Muhammad Yunus-led government, with unchecked violence, rising extremism and worsening ties with India.

Sridhar Vembu says Zoho is working on some important features for Arattai appSridhar Vembu, the founder of Zoho, revealed the ongoing weekly updates for the Arattai chat app. The firm is planning a marketing push once the feature set is perfected, indicating a patient long-term strategy.

No degree, no scholarship, yet Srinivasa Ramanujan changed mathematics foreverSrinivasa Ramanujan failed formal exams but revolutionised mathematics through self-study. His legacy challenges rigid education systems and inspires India annually on National Mathematics Day.

Why is India's Gen Z quietly quitting without resigning?The Gen Z in India is redefining disengagement not by walking out of offices, but by emotionally checking out while remaining on payrolls. Resignations are scanty and this absence is masking a deeper crisis brewing inside workplaces.

Students arrested for calling Collector Tina Dabi 'reel star'Students in Barmer protested against a college fee hike, leading to the arrest of student leaders and a sit-in at a police station. The incident sparked a political debate involving remarks about District Collector Tina Dabi and concerns over civic issues.

Polls hang fire: How Mumbai's BMC managed without a mayor for 4 yearsThe election for Mumbai civic body BMC has been postponed yet again. For nearly five years, India's financial capital has operated without an elected mayor. A state-appointed administrator has been the head of BMC since March 2022. Polls are finally set to happen on January 15 now. Here's what was behind the delay in polls for India's richest civic body, whose leadership influences state politics.

Is Telugu cinema falling behind in the pan-India race? Why 2025 felt like a warningDespite big openings and Rs 100 crore films, Telugu cinema's pan-India presence weakened in 2025, raising questions about over-dependence on stars, shrinking creative risk, and the sustainability of the current model.

Bangladesh identifies Osman Hadi shooter, issues lookout notice, imposes travel banBangladesh is witnessing widespread unrest following the killing of youth leader Sharif Osman Hadi, with authorities intensifying efforts to apprehend the main accused. The government has issued travel bans and lookout notices amid rising protests across the country.

Mahayuti sweeps Maharashtra local body polls, wins 207 seats; BJP largest partyThe BJP emerged as the single-largest winner with 117 municipal president posts, followed by the Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena with 53 and the NCP with 37.

MGNREGA bulldozed, right to work demolished: Sonia Gandhi rips into governmentSonia Gandhi accused Modi government of dismantling MGNREGA, warning of severe impacts on rural India. She argued that the new G RAM G law replaces guaranteed work with a discretionary scheme, threatening livelihoods and decentralised governance.

sports.headline: NZ vs WI: Jacob Duffy's 5-wicket haul sets up 2-0 series win for NZ with 323-run win New Zealand beat West Indies by 323 runs in the third Test to claim the series 2-0. Jacob Duffy was adjudged Player of the Match for taking his third five-wicket haul.

The day I blast…: Surya's speech on poor form at Ahmedabad university goes viral Backed despite lean returns, Suryakumar Yadav reiterated his acknowledgement of a dip in T20I form in 2025. The India captain will be under pressure as he prepares the team for the T20 World Cup, starting February 7.

New Zealand's Suzie Bates ruled out for three months due to quadriceps injury New Zealand opener Suzie Bates will miss the remainder of the domestic season and upcoming White Ferns series due to a quadriceps injury. She is determined to recover in time for the South Africa tour, aiming to return strong despite the setback.

A snub that stings: What Shubman Gill can learn from Rohit Sharma Seen as India's future across formats as recently as a few months ago, Shubman Gill now faces a rare pause. His T20 World Cup omission hurts, but history suggests setbacks shape leaders more than seamless ascents ever do.

England's cockiness cost the Ashes, Australia are laughing at them: Vaughan Former captain Michael Vaughan has strongly criticised England's approach following their another Ashes series loss in Australia. England's defeat in Adelaide, resulting in a 0-3 deficit, has intensified scrutiny over the team's attitude and preparation, with Vaughan calling the outcome 'humbling.'

Vaishnavi Sharma credits captain Harmanpreet after debut heroics vs Sri Lanka IND-W vs SL-W: Vaishnavi Sharma impressed on her international debut with a disciplined four-over spell, helping India restrict Sri Lanka to 121/6. Sharma praised captain Harmanpreet Kaur's leadership, highlighting her influence both before and during the match.

With Bazball now pronounced dead, can England afford to sack Brendon McCullum? Australia's demolition of England has exposed the limits of Bazball and left the ECB facing a stark choice: evolve with McCullum, or risk another identity crisis by sacking him.

IND vs SL: Why waste good form? Jemimah Rodrigues making India's No.3 her own Jemimah Rodrigues laid down the marker and proved why she is India's No.3 for the long haul as they defeated Sri Lanka in the first T20I on Sunday, December 21. With the T20 World Cup coming up, the 25-year-old is ready to make the spot her own and be a vital part of the Indian team.

IND vs SL: No World Cup hangover as India thrash Sri Lanka in 1st T20I The Indian women's team put on a dominant performance to thrash Sri Lanka by eight wickets to start the T20I series with a win in Vizag on Sunday, December 21.

IND vs SL: Smriti Mandhana hits new milestone after return to action Smriti Mandhana crossed a new milestone as she became the second player in women's T20Is to get to the 4,000-run mark during the first match of the series between India and Sri Lanka.

Rohit Sharma contemplated retirement after 2023 World Cup: Felt I had nothing leftFormer India captain Rohit Sharma revealed that he considered retirement after the loss to Australia in the final of the 2023 World Cup. India stumbled at the final hurdle with the Aussies securing a comfortable win.

Green is the future: Why KKR went big for all-rounder in IPL 2026 auctionKolkata Knight Riders head coach Abhishek Nayar details the strategic acquisition of Australian all-rounder Cameron Green at the IPL 2026 auction, highlighting the franchise's intent to strengthen its top order and fill the gap left by Andre Russell's departure.

Sports must get priority, says Bhaichung Bhutia after Messi's chaotic India tourFormer India football captain Bhaichung Bhutia and national team defender Sandesh Jhingan have spoken out following the disorder at Lionel Messi's Kolkata event, highlighting the need for sport to take precedence over politics at major football occasions.

Who is Vaishnavi Sharma? U19 sensation rewarded with T20I debut in VisakhapatnamIND vs SL, Women's T20Is: India handed a debut to U19 star Vaishnavi Sharma against Sri Lanka, reflecting a bold push to expand depth ahead of the T20 World Cup. The 20-year-old spinner's rise adds fresh promise to the squad.

India snub Naqvi after U19 Asia Cup final, PCB chief joins Pakistan celebrationsIndia snubbed Mohsin Naqvi completely during the U19 Asia Cup final post-match presentation while the PCB chairman decided to hand the trophy to Pakistan and celebrate with them after their win on Sunday, November 21.

Hope for Indian football? Asian Football Confederation set to launch Nations LeagueWith ISL governance in limbo and commercial uncertainty mounting, the AFC Nations League arrives as a rare opportunity for India to secure meaningful fixtures and competitive continuity amid domestic turbulence.

1st T20I Highlights: Jemimah's unbeaten fifty gives India 8-wicket winIndia Women vs Sri Lanka Women 1st T20I Highlights: A composed finish from India sees Jemimah Rodrigues and Harmanpreet Kaur steer the chase home, capitalising on Sri Lanka's late misfields. Smart rotation under pressure seals a clinical win and highlights India's poise.

India stunned as Pakistan clinch U19 Asia Cup title with 191-run winPakistan beat India by 191 runs in the final to win their second U19 Asia Cup title. Sameer Minhas scored 172, after which Ali Raza's four-wicket haul helped Pakistan bowl their opponents out for 156 in the final.

Suryavanshi's U19 Asia Cup final flop show: Spat with Ali Raza, slammed by fansVaibhav Suryavanshi had a day to forget in the U19 Asia Cup Final as he had another poor performance with the bat against Pakistan. Suryavanshi then had a spat with Ali Raza and the fans slammed his performance on the day.

NZ vs WI: Conway, Latham create a first in Tests with twin centuriesDevon Conway and Tom Latham set unprecedented records as New Zealand's opening pair, both scoring two centuries each in the same Test against the West Indies at Bay Oval.

Job's done: Pat Cummins opts out of MCG Test, emphasises WTC outcome not a concernPat Cummins is set to miss the Boxing Day Test as Australia, having already retained the Ashes, focus on managing risks despite a dominant World Test Championship run. On Sunday, the Aussies took a 3-0 lead in the series with an 82-run win at the Adelaide Oval.

Did England flop in Ashes preparation? Brendon McCullum admits regret after series lossEngland coach Brendon McCullum admitted that his side got their preparations wrong for the Ashes 2025-26 series as Australia retained their crown with a win in the Adelaide Test.

Conway, Latham's twin tons put New Zealand in control, West Indies face big chaseNew Zealand's openers made history with twin tons in both innings, setting West Indies 462 on a placid Bay Oval pitch. With all results still possible, the visitors face a stern test of skill and resolve on Day 5.

Big Hug: Smriti Mandhana's response for young Kashmiri fangirl wins heartsIndian women's batter Smriti Mandhana won hearts with a touching reply to a young fan in Kashmir as she gears up to chase a historic 4,000-run milestone in Women's T20Is during the five-match series against Sri Lanka.

Who is Sameer Minhas? Pakistan batter hits 113-ball 172 in U19 Asia Cup finalU19 Asia Cup final, IND vs PAK: Sameer Minhas was at his stupendous best in the grand finale after he scored 172 off 113 balls with 17 fours and nine sixes against India at the ICC Academy Ground in Dubai on Sunday.

Bazball has failed, McCullum must go: Boycott slams England after Ashes letdownGeoffrey Boycott has launched a blistering attack on Bazball after England's latest Ashes collapse. With Australia retaining the urn, Boycott insists England must change leadership and mindset to avoid repeating familiar failures.

Can't be so poor: Disappointed Ben Stokes slams England after conceding AshesAshes 2025, AUS vs ENG: Skipper Ben Stokes admitted England's poor execution cost them the Ashes after an 82-run loss at the Adelaide Oval left them 0–3 down, with Australia consistently outplaying them in all departments.

Repeating history? India turn to proven ODI World Cup formula for T20I successIND-W vs SL-W: India have taken an experimental approach in their preparations for the T20 World Cup, calling up Vaishnavi Sharma and G Kamalini for the T20I series against Sri Lanka. Both Kamalini and Vaishnavi helped India lift the U19 Women's T20 World Cup earlier this year.

Sanju Samson's road to T20 World Cup 2026: A Malayalam entertainer in the makingSanju Samson's journey to India's T20 World Cup 2026 squad reads like a Mohanlal-led Mollywood classic — full of promise, setbacks, and quiet resilience before a hometown send-off in Trivandrum.

Messi came and left, but Indian football stays stuck in one placeFor a few days, Indian football felt alive again. Once Lionel Messi left, the silence returned, exposing a stalled ISL, anxious players and a system struggling to survive without the glare of spectacle.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
